paper_abstract: Let eta a parts per thousand yen0 be an integer and G be a graph. A set XaS dagger V(G) is called a eta-treewidth modulator in G if Ga-X has treewidth at most eta. Note that a 0-treewidth modulator is a vertex cover, while a 1-treewidth modulator is a feedback vertex set of G. In the eta/rho-Treewidth Modulator problem we are given an undirected graph G, a rho-treewidth modulator XaS dagger V(G) in G, and an integer a"" and the objective is to determine whether there exists an eta-treewidth modulator ZaS dagger V(G) in G of size at most a"". In this paper we study the kernelization complexity of eta/rho-Treewidth Modulator parameterized by the size of X. We show that for every fixed eta and rho that either satisfy 1a parts per thousand currency sign eta <rho, or eta=0 and 2a parts per thousand currency sign rho, the eta/rho-Treewidth Modulator problem does not admit a polynomial kernel unless NPaS dagger coNP/poly. This resolves an open problem raised by Bodlaender and Jansen (STACS, pp. 177-188, 2011). Finally, we complement our kernelization lower bounds by showing that rho/0-Treewidth Modulator admits a polynomial kernel for any fixed rho.
paper_title: On the Hardness of Losing Width
